Then I created … „3D Earth Scene with WebGL“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
We live in times of abundant narcissism, that’s where the idea for the 3D scene â€žPlanet Smiling Selfieâ€œ came from. The code was provided by the educators of the online course 3D Graphics for Web Developers.

I replaced earthâ€™s map with a giant self-made smiley but left earthâ€™s specular map & clouds. Then I created an animated brush for GIMP and painted the starfield with a lot of smileys. Sounds easy enough

item.title: Designing a Space in 3D (Task)
item.dc:creator: Martin VÃ¶geli
item.description: For the 3D animation â€žTitanic’s Victims â€“ Echoes from the Sea Floorâ€œ I imagined a remote-controlled submarine with a spotlight transmitting noisy video & spooky sounds from the ancient sunken passenger ship. Download the original video file for better (noise) quality! This is my first Blender project, so I had to learn a few things, … „Designing a Space in 3D (Task)“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
For the 3D animation â€žTitanic’s Victims â€“ Echoes from the Sea Floorâ€œ I imagined a remote-controlled submarine with a spotlight transmitting noisy video & spooky sounds from the ancient sunken passenger ship.

Download the original video file for better (noise) quality!

This is my first Blender project, so I had to learn a few things, e.g. how to make a camera follow a path or how to control the lighting. The Blender infographic map smoothed the way for me â€“ thank you very much!

Title & credits was created with the image editing program GIMP and the graphics knot & seahorse form openclipart.org. I took the 3D models (gramophone, shoes, cello, rocking horse & bell) from archive3d.net.

The choral NÃ¤her, mein Gott, zu Dir is in the public domain, the free sound effects are from YouTube’s Audio Library. Audio editing & mixing was done with Audacity â€“ like Blender & GIMP a free software!

# Add Gaussian noise to the images
for i in *.png; do convert +noise Gaussian $i $i; done
# Merge images to video (16000k with Gaussian noise)
avconv -framerate 24 -i %04d.png -b 5000k video.mp4
# Combine video and audio to one file
avconv -i video.mp4 -i audio.m4a -c copy video+audio.mp4

PS: YouTube offers a page with recommended upload encoding settings (container: MP4, audio codec: AAC-LC and video codec: H.264). It also suggests appropriate frame rate, bitrate, resolution and aspect ratio.

PPS: The course instructors curate 3D animations in this playlist.

item.title: Switching from LastPass to Firefox Sync
item.dc:creator: Martin VÃ¶geli
item.description: I use my tablet more often recently, so I need my passwords on more than one deviceâ€¦ I seized the opportunity to quit my password manager LastPass and switch to Firefox Sync (free software). LastPass offers a â€žSecurity Challengeâ€œ which I employed to identify and change weak passwords during the migration â€“ logging into all … „Switching from LastPass to Firefox Sync“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
I use my tablet more often recently, so I need my passwords on more than one deviceâ€¦ I seized the opportunity to quit my password manager LastPass and switch to Firefox Sync (free software).

LastPass offers a â€žSecurity Challengeâ€œ which I employed to identify and change weak passwords during the migration â€“ logging into all of my accounts and accepting Firefox to store the passwordsâ€¦

I started with 367 accounts but many online services are no more, so the number went down to 223. Amazing, how many online services seemed useful at the time and I simply forgot about them!

Firefox Sync also handles bookmarks, so I imported all of my 6003 bookmarks from del.icio.us and Diigo. Afterwards I let the Firefox add-on iMacros delete them from the social bookmarking sites.

Finally, I activated Pocket for Firefox: â€žClick the Pocket button in your Firefox toolbar to save articles, videos, pages, and more. You can view them later in Pocket on any device.â€œ Whatâ€™s next?

item.title: Pixilation Task Revisited
item.dc:creator: Martin VÃ¶geli
item.description: For â€žYogilation â€“ A Pixelated Yogi in Pixilationâ€œ I videotaped myself practicing yoga and extracted the relevant frames with VLC (hotkeys â€žeâ€œ for frame by frame navigation and â€žCtrl+sâ€œ for snapshot). I recycled the accordion music from my â€žPixilation Taskâ€œ, reversed it and applied the effect â€žPaulstretchâ€œ with Audacity. For the graphical effects (brightness, contrast … „Pixilation Task Revisited“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
For â€žYogilation â€“ A Pixelated Yogi in Pixilationâ€œ I videotaped myself practicing yoga and extracted the relevant frames with VLC (hotkeys â€žeâ€œ for frame by frame navigation and â€žCtrl+sâ€œ for snapshot).

I recycled the accordion music from my â€žPixilation Taskâ€œ, reversed it and applied the effect â€žPaulstretchâ€œ with Audacity. For the graphical effects (brightness, contrast and pixelation) I used the command-line:

# Apply brightness and contrast to each frame
for i in *.png; do convert -brightness-contrast 11x22 $i $i; done
# Apply the pixelation effect to each frame
for i in *.png; do convert -scale 10% -scale 1000% $i $i; done
# Merge individual frames to video
avconv -framerate 12 -f image2 -i %04d.png -b 16000k video.mov

item.title: Pixilation Task
item.dc:creator: Martin VÃ¶geli
item.description: For the pixilation â€žAccordilation â€“ Accordion in Pixilationâ€œ I videotaped myself playing accordion, grabbed four frames per second, added a title, applied a charcoal filter and merged the frames to video again. The course instructors curate pixilation animations in this playlist. I used the command-line interface (with a little help for ImageMagick and Libav) on … „Pixilation Task“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
For the pixilation â€žAccordilation â€“ Accordion in Pixilationâ€œ I videotaped myself playing accordion, grabbed four frames per second, added a title, applied a charcoal filter and merged the frames to video again.

The course instructors curate pixilation animations in this playlist. I used the command-line interface (with a little help for ImageMagick and Libav) on my laptop with Ubuntu. The commands Iâ€™ve executed:

# Grab four frames per second
avconv -i videotape.mp4 -vsync 1 -r 4 -an -y -qscale 1 %04d.jpg
# Extract the audio
avconv -i videotape.mp4 -c:a copy -vn -y audio.aac
# Apply a charcoal filter to each frame
for i in *.jpg; do convert $i -charcoal 2 $i; done
# Merge individual frames to video
avconv -framerate 4 -f image2 -i %04d.jpg -b 65536k video.mov
# Combine video and audio
avconv -i video.mov -i audio.aac -c copy video+audio.mov

The course instructors found … „Cel Animation Task“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
For the cel animation â€žWalk Wait Waveâ€œ I used theÂ Stick Fighter app on my tablet for the stick figures and theÂ video editor Quik to add the title as well as a nice background music:

FilmoraGo is another good video editor, but it adds its name at the end of the video. The course instructors found thisÂ helpful video of the walk cycle and curate cel animations in this playlist.

The course instructors curate … „Stop Motion Task“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
For the stop motion animation â€žCubingâ€œ I set up my desk with three lamps for lighting, my laptop as background and a tablet with the Stop-Motion Movie Creator app for production:

FutureLearn is a social learning environment at its heartÂ â€“ here are some social media tips and tools for social learners. The course instructors curate stop motion animations in this playlist.

item.title: Flip Book Task

item.description: My submission for the online course Explore Animation. I used GIMP to stitch together the individual pictures, reduce the number of colours and resize the final GIF animation: Thomas and Johnstonâ€™s twelve principles of animation are illustrated well by this video and also in these animations. TheÂ course instructors curate flipbooks in this playlist.
item.content:encoded:
My submission for the online course Explore Animation. I used GIMP to stitch together the individual pictures, reduce the number of colours and resize the final GIF animation:

Thomas and Johnstonâ€™s twelve principles of animation are illustrated well by this video and also in these animations. TheÂ course instructors curate flipbooks in this playlist.

item.description: Ich lese viel und gerneâ€¦ Hier prÃ¤sentiere ich einige meiner aktuellen Favoriten in alÂ­phaÂ­beÂ­tischer Reihenfolge â€“ und bin gespannt auf Tipps und Kommentare von euch! Romane AccelerandoÂ (Charles Stross) Harry Potter and the Methods of RationalityÂ (Eliezer Yudkowsky) Homo FaberÂ (Max Frisch) Millennium (series)Â (Stieg Larsson & David Lagercrantz) Off to Be the WizardÂ (Scott Meyer) Ready Player One & … „Hacker’s Digest â€“ Don’t Panic“ weiterlesen
item.content:encoded:
Ich lese viel und gerneâ€¦ Hier prÃ¤sentiere ich einige meiner aktuellen Favoriten in alÂ­phaÂ­beÂ­tischer Reihenfolge â€“ und bin gespannt auf Tipps und Kommentare von euch!

Romane

  • AccelerandoÂ (Charles Stross)
  • Harry Potter and the Methods of RationalityÂ (Eliezer Yudkowsky)
  • Homo FaberÂ (Max Frisch)
  • Millennium (series)Â (Stieg Larsson & David Lagercrantz)
  • Off to Be the WizardÂ (Scott Meyer)
  • Ready Player One & ArmadaÂ (Ernest Cline)
  • The CircleÂ (Dave Eggers)
  • The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy (series) (Douglas Adams)
  • The MartianÂ (Andy Weir)
  • The Once and Future King (T. H. White)

Lesetipps von den Teilnehmern:

  • Daemon (series) (Daniel Suarez)
  • Der aufrechte Mann (Davide Longo)
  • Dirk Gently’s Holistic Detective Agency & The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul (Douglas Adams)
  • Rainbows End (Vernor Vinge)
  • Starfish (Peter Watts)
  • The Futurological Congress (StanisÅ‚aw Lem)

SachbÃ¼cher

  • A Short History of Nearly Everything
  • For the Love of Physics
  • What If?: Serious Scientific Answers to Absurd Hypothetical Questions

Lesetipps von den Teilnehmern:

  • Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction (Steve McConnell)
  • Packing for Mars: The Curious Science of Life in the Void (DE: Was macht der Astronaut, wenn er mal muss?) (Mary Roach)
  • Thing Explainer: Complicated Stuff in Simple Words (Randall Munroe)
  • Weniger schlecht programmieren (Kathrin Passig & Johannes Jander)
